question: Who developed Jij Muhammad-shahi in 18th century India?
explanation: In the first half of the 18th century, Sawai Jai Singh built the pink city of Jaipur and five astronomical conservatives at Delhi, Jaipur, Benares, Mathura and Ujjain. He also prepared a set of time-tables called Jij Muhammad-shahi, to help the people in the study of astronomy.
